title: Two Sum (Algorithms)
summary: Learn a common array/hashmap technique to solve Two Sum.
content:
# Two Sum

Use a hashmap to store seen values and their indices. Iterate once and check for complement.

questions.prompt: What is the key idea behind the optimal Two Sum solution?
options: Sort the array and use binary search for every element
Use a hashmap to remember seen values and look up complements
Use recursion to try all pairs
questions.explanation: A hashmap lets you check the complement in O(1) average time, giving O(n) overall.

title: Binary Search (Algorithms)
summary: Binary search fundamentals for sorted arrays.
content:
# Binary Search

Divide and conquer using low/high pointers.

questions.prompt: What must be true for binary search to work correctly?
options: The array must contain unique values
The array must be small enough to fit in memory
questions.explanation: Binary search relies on ordering to discard half the search space each step.

title: Debounce (Frontend)
summary: Implement debounce to batch rapid events.
content:
# Debounce

Use a timer and closure to delay execution.

options: Runs a function at most once per interval
Delays a function until events stop firing for a period
Runs a function in a separate thread
questions.explanation: Debounce waits until there is a pause in events, then runs the function once.
